intro: Stelis carioi, commonly known as the Cariño stelis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic lifestyle. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Botanically, it belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is notable for its intricate floral structure and specialized pollination mechanisms.
